text: was an old province of Japan in the area of Kagoshima Prefecture on the island of Kyūshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Ōsumi" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 762. It was sometimes called . Ōsumi had borders with Hyūga and Satsuma Provinces. The ancient capital city of the province was near Kokubu. ==History== In 713 (Wadō 6, 3rd month), the land of Ōsumi Province was separated from Hyūga.Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, p. 64. In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Ōsumi Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. Japan's first satellite was named Ōsumi. It was launched February 11, 1970.Turnill, Reginald. (1986). Jane's Spaceflight Directory, p. 20; Nussbaum, "Ōsumi" at p. 762. ==Shrines and Temples== Kagoshima jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Ōsumi. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 2 ; retrieved 2012-1-18. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan * Osumi Seamount ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Kagoshima Prefecture
title: Ōsumi Province
